net.markenwerk.utils.json.handler

Interface JsonHandler<Result>

  • Type Parameters:
    Result - The result type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IdleJsonHandler, NullJsonHandler

    public interface JsonHandler<Result>
    A JsonHandler provides a collection of callback methods that can be called for a sequence of events that describe a JSON document. A JsonHandler can calculate a result for the described JSON document.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Result getResult()
      Returns the calculated result.
      void onArrayBegin()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON array started.
      void onArrayEnd()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON array ended.
      void onBoolean(boolean value)
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON boolean.
      void onDocumentBegin()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON document started.
      void onDocumentEnd()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON document ended.
      void onDouble(double value)
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON number, that represents a decimal value.
      void onLong(long value)
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON number, that represents an integer value.
      void onName(String name)
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered the name for the next JSON value.
      void onNext()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON array or JSON object encountered another element.
      void onNull()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON null.
      void onObjectBegin()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object started.
      void onObjectEnd()
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object ended.
      void onString(String value)
      Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON string.

    • Method Detail

      • onDocumentBegin

        void onDocumentBegin()
              throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON document started.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onDocumentEnd

        void onDocumentEnd()
            throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON document ended.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onArrayBegin

        void onArrayBegin()
           throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON array started. A corresponding call for the end must eventually be called.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onArrayEnd

        void onArrayEnd()
         throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON array ended.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onObjectBegin

        void onObjectBegin()
            throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object started. A corresponding call for the end must eventually be called.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onObjectEnd

        void onObjectEnd()
          throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object ended.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onName

        void onName(String name)
     throws JsonIndexException,
            JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered the name for the next JSON value.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Parameters:
        name - The name for the next JSON value.
        Throws:
        JsonIndexException - If the given value is null.
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onNext

        void onNext()
     throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON array or JSON object encountered another element.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onNull

        void onNull()
     throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON null.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onBoolean

        void onBoolean(boolean value)
        throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON boolean.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Parameters:
        value - The value of the JSON boolean.
        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onLong

        void onLong(long value)
     throws JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON number, that represents an integer value.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Parameters:
        value - The value of the JSON number.
        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onDouble

        void onDouble(double value)
       throws JsonValueException,
              JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON number, that represents a decimal value.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Parameters:
        value - The value of the JSON number.
        Throws:
        JsonValueException - If the given value is not a number or infinite.
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • onString

        void onString(String value)
       throws JsonValueException,
              JsonException
        Called when the parsing of a JSON object encountered a JSON string.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Parameters:
        value - The value of the JSON string.
        Throws:
        JsonValueException - If the given value is null.
        JsonException - If the handling failed.

      • getResult

        Result getResult()
          throws JsonException
        Returns the calculated result.

        Implementers should catch any exception that isn't a JsonException and wrap them in an appropriate JsonException (e.g. a JsonHandlingException).

        Returns:
        The calculated result.
        Throws:
        JsonException - If the handling failed.
